mainMenu

Class donutsSceneController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainMenu.donutsSceneController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class donutsSceneController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The donutsSceneController class handles the main functionalities in ordering and customizing a donut. Randomizes the available flavors in the store and handles the ordering of either cake donuts, yeast donuts, or donut holes for an order and can handle different amounts.
    Author:
    Jah C. Speed, Abe Vitangcol

    • Method Detail

      • addToListView

        public void addToListView()
        Adds the donut order into the list of donut orders made so far. Can be edited to change the order or be removed before going to the basket to confirm the order.

      • checkAmount

        private int checkAmount()
        Checks if the amount field is a valid number.
        Returns:
        -1 if the number is less than or equal to 0 or not a number, 0 otherwise.

      • checkDonutFlavor

        private int checkDonutFlavor()
        Checks if the donut flavor was selected in the order process.
        Returns:
        -1 if the donut flavor was not selected, 0 otherwise.

      • checkDonutType

        private int checkDonutType()
        Checks if a donut type was selected in the order process.
        Returns:
        -1 if the donut type was not selected, 0 otherwise.

      • confirmOrder

        public void confirmOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Confirms the order to add it to the basket to be checked out. Correctly compiles the clicked and customized areas to have a donut order.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click on the "Confirm" button.

      • getRandomFlavors

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRandomFlavors(java.lang.String[] list,
                                                              int pullItems)
        Gets a random number of flavors to put into the flavors menu. The flavor numbers are as defined at the top as MIN_FLAVORS and MAX_FLAVORS
        Parameters:
        list - The list of flavors possible. pullItems The number of flavors to pull from the list.
        Returns:
        The list of random flavors the menu will have.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL arg0,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle arg1)
        Initializes the GUI by initializing the randomized flavors of the day, setting print areas to blank, and the list view full of donut orders.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        arg0 - used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known. arg1 used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

      • randomIntFromInterval

        public int randomIntFromInterval(int min,
                                 int max)
        Generates a random integer value from a stated range.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value of the range. max The maximum value of the range.
        Returns:
        The random integer generated.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all the changeable fields back to normal after processing an order.

      • setEdit

        private void setEdit(java.lang.String donutType,
                     java.lang.String flavor,
                     int amount)
        Edit the selected order and change various fields before submitting it again.
        Parameters:
        donutType - The type of donut selected of the specific order. flavor The flavor of the donut of the specific order. amount The amount of donuts desired as specified on the order.

      • swapToMainMenuScene

        public void swapToMainMenuScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Swaps the current scene back to the main menu in order to do other actions.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click on the "Main Menu" button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
